p: Lignocellulosic fibers are the largest source of renewable bioresources in the world. Generally, lignocellulosic materials are composed of 35–55 wt % cellulose, 10–25 wt % lignin and 20–40 wt % hemicellulose in addition to extracts (e.g., pectin, resins, waxes, etc.), ash and minerals [ 36, 37].
